abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Social Development
            and Public Works Project is to enhance the living standards
            in Djibouti, through increased access to basic economic and
            social infrastructure, and services, in addition to
            employment generation opportunities. Ultimately, the project
            will contribute to poverty reduction in the city. The
            project includes three components: 1) Social and economic
            infrastructure works will improve the physical environment
            in poor neighborhoods. Mainly, small infrastructure works
            will improve streets and drainage on secondary and tertiary
            networks. Construction/rehabilitation of commercial
            infrastructure, such as markets and public places, will be
            included, in addition to social infrastructure, i.e.,
            standpipes, health posts, schools, and the like. 2) Support
            to community development, complements the works of the first
            component, and will specifically, increase community
            participation in project implementation; and, social
            services will be provided to poor communities, through the
            Social Mobilization Program and the Community Subproject
            Grants, supporting and financing community development
            activities. 3) The third component, will strengthen the
            institutional capacity of stakeholders involved with the
            implementation of the previous two components, through
            poverty monitoring and analysis, and, project management and implementation.
